HelpXML.Title: HAeff
HelpXML.Purpose: HAeff finds the tuning constant that guarrantees a requested asymptotic efficiency

Item.Name: eff
Item.LongDesc: Scalar which contains the required efficiency (of location or scale estimator). Generally eff=0.85, 0.9 or 0.95.

Item.Name: v
Item.LongDesc: Number of variables of the dataset (for regression v=1) UP TO NOW v=1 (JUST REGRESSION) TO DO FOR MULTIVARIATE ANALYSIS

Item.Name: abc
Item.LongDesc: Vector of length 3 which contains the parameters of Hampel estimator. If vector abc is not specified it is set equal to [2, 4, 8]

Item.Name: ceff
Item.LongDesc: Tuning constatnt of Hampel rho function associated to requested value of efficiency

HelpXML.MoreAbout:
Function HApsi transforms vector u as follows. \[ HApsi(u) = \left\{ \begin{array}{cc} u & |u| <= a \\ a \times sign(u) & a <= |u| < b \\ a \frac{c-|u|}{c-b} \times sign(u) & b <= |u| < c \\ 0 & |u| >= c \end{array} \right. \]
where $a$= ctun *param(1). $b$= ctun *param(2). $c$= ctun *param(3).
The default is $a$= 2*ctun. $b$= 4*ctun. $c$= 8*ctun.
It is necessary to have 0 <= a <= b <= c

References.Item: D. C. Hoaglin, F. Mosteller, J. W. Tukey (1982), Understanding Robust and Exploratory Data Analysis Wiley, New York.
